segments.key_quote: As the name and fame of a particular body is finished with the disappearance of the living spirit, similarly, if you do not look upon us, all our fame and activities, along with the Pandavas and Yadus, will end at once.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces and explains the meaning of Queen Kunti's prayer, emphasizing the devotee's dependence on Krishna.
segments.transcript: Continuing the prayers by Queen Kunti. KVAYAM NAMA ROOPABHYAM YADUBI SAHAPANDAVAH BHAVATO ADHARSHANAM YARIHI HRISHIKANAM IVESHITUHU. The meaning of this verse is: As the name and fame of a particular body is finished with the disappearance of the living spirit, similarly, if you do not look upon us, all our fame and activities, along with the Pandavas and Yadus, will end at once.

segments.key_quote: We should know that every moment I should be dependent on Krishna's mercy only.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the concept of dependence on Krishna, urging listeners to be constantly Krishna conscious and avoid complacency.
segments.transcript: This is yet another prayer offered by Queen Kunti to Krishna, that the devotees are very well aware that their existence is totally dependent on Krishna, and only because of Krishna's mercy, they are able to perform their duties. They are able to perform activities in a nice way. And the example is being given, when the spirit soul leaves the body, the body is a useless piece of dead matter. But as long as the spirit is there, the body is having so many nice life symptoms. Actually, the body is always matter, dead matter. But the presence of the spirit makes it appear to be having life. And the absence of the spirit means immediately the body starts decomposing. It cannot be sustained anymore. So in the Purport, Srila Prabhupada explains, "The body is quite aware that the existence of the Pandavas is due to Shri Krishna only." This point has to be very, very nicely understood. And only then we become very serious in Krishna consciousness and not be complacent in our practice. In this material world, while we are still here, we should not be complacent. We should know that every moment I should be dependent on Krishna's mercy only.

segments.key_quote: But without the guidance of Lord Krishna, all of them are non-entities.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes that even great figures like Yudhishthira and the Yadus are insignificant without Krishna's guidance.
segments.transcript: And for that, I have to be Krishna conscious always, not sometimes, always. The Pandavas are undoubtedly well established in name and fame and are guided by a great king, Yudhishthira, whose morality personified. He is called Dharma because he is morality personified. And the Yadus are undoubtedly great allies of the Pandavas. But without the guidance of Lord Krishna, all of them are non-entities.

segments.key_quote: No one should be proud of his prestige, power and fame, without being guided by the favor of the Supreme Lord.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the importance of background consciousness and the need to be aware of the Supreme Lord's favor in all circumstances.
segments.transcript: which are all from this material world? The object that is seen makes some sense, we make some sense out of it, what it is or what is the purpose or what it is, what my relationship with it is, etc., etc., only because there is the background consciousness for the seeing, for the hearing, for the thinking, for the feeling, everything. There is a background consciousness. No one should be proud of his prestige, power and fame, without being guided by the favor of the Supreme Lord. He will be always conscious of this favor of the Supreme Lord upon each one of us, under all circumstances.

segments.key_quote: We should never wrongly think that I am dependent on something other than Krishna, someone other than Krishna.
segments.summary: The speaker warns against relying on material solutions and emphasizes that Krishna is the ultimate source of protection, using the example of earthquake-proof buildings.
segments.transcript: The living beings are always dependent and the ultimate dependable object is the Lord himself. We should never wrongly think that I am dependent on something other than Krishna, someone other than Krishna. No, that is not possible. We may therefore invent by our advancement of material knowledge all sorts of counteracting material resources, but without being guided by the Lord. All such inventions end in fiasco, however strong and stout the reactionary elements may be, just like we sometimes hear, oh, this building is earthquake proof. All such inventions end in fiasco, however strong and stout the reactionary elements may be, just like we sometimes hear, oh, this building is earthquake proof. the building to collapse during an earthquake that provision that is made is alone not enough.

segments.summary: The speaker reiterates the importance of Krishna's protection and the ultimate failure of material arrangements, even for important figures after death.
